p: The radical scavenging capacity of the essential oil and major terpenes of S. macrostema were assayed with an 2,2’-azinobis-3-ethylbenzothiazoline-6-sulfonic acid (ABTS) (Sigma-Aldrich, Mexico) assay according to the protocol of Rufino et al.[ 28] with some modifications. The ABTS radical solution was prepared mixing 7.4 mmol/L ABTS and 2.6 mmol/L potassium persulfate (Meyer, México). Samples of 100 μL were subsequently mixed with 1900 μL ABTS radical solution, and the absorbance of the resulting mixtures was measured after 7 min at 737 nm with UV/VIS spectrophotometer.
